name: manufacturers_accounts_languages_productCertifications_patch
description: Updates (or creates if allow_missing = true) a product certification which links certifications with products. This method can only be called by certification bodies.

name.description: Required. The unique name identifier of a product certification Format: accounts/{account}/languages/{language_code}/productCertifications/{id} Where `id` is a some unique identifier and `language_code` is a 2-letter ISO 639-1 code of a Shopping supported language according to https://support.google.com/merchants/answer/160637.

updateMask.description: Optional. The list of fields to update according to aip.dev/134. However, only full update is supported as of right now. Therefore, it can be either ignored or set to "*". Setting any other values will returns UNIMPLEMENTED error.

fields.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response.

key.description: API key. Your API key identifies your project and provides you with API access, quota, and reports. Required unless you provide an OAuth 2.0 token.

oauth_token.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

prettyPrint.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks.

quotaUser.description: Available to use for quota purposes for server-side applications. Can be any arbitrary string assigned to a user, but should not exceed 40 characters.

brand.description: Required. This is the product's brand name. The brand is used to help identify your product.

certification.description: Required. A list of certifications to link to the described product.

destinationStatuses.description: Output only. The statuses of the destinations.

issues.description: Output only. A server-generated list of issues associated with the product.

mpn.description: Optional. These are the Manufacturer Part Numbers (MPN). MPNs are used to uniquely identify a specific product among all products from the same manufacturer

name.description: Required. The unique name identifier of a product certification Format: accounts/{account}/languages/{language_code}/productCertifications/{id} Where `id` is a some unique identifier and `language_code` is a 2-letter ISO 639-1 code of a Shopping supported language according to https://support.google.com/merchants/answer/160637.

productType.description: Optional. These are your own product categorization system in your product data.

title.description: Required. This is to clearly identify the product you are certifying.

authority.description: Required. Name of the certification body.

code.description: Required. A unique code to identify the certification.

link.description: Optional. A URL link to the certification.

logo.description: Optional. A URL link to the certification logo.

value.description: Optional. A custom value of the certification.

attribute.description: If present, the attribute that triggered the issue. For more information about attributes, see https://support.google.com/manufacturers/answer/6124116.

description.description: Longer description of the issue focused on how to resolve it.

destination.description: The destination this issue applies to.

resolution.description: What needs to happen to resolve the issue.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when this issue appeared.

title.description: Short title describing the nature of the issue.

type.description: The server-generated type of the issue, for example, “INCORRECT_TEXT_FORMATTING”, “IMAGE_NOT_SERVEABLE”, etc.

$ul: **brand**: Required. This is the product's brand name. The brand is used to help identify your product.
**certification**: Required. A list of certifications to link to the described product.
**destinationStatuses**: Output only. The statuses of the destinations.
**issues**: Output only. A server-generated list of issues associated with the product.
**mpn**: Optional. These are the Manufacturer Part Numbers (MPN). MPNs are used to uniquely identify a specific product among all products from the same manufacturer

**name**: Required. The unique name identifier of a product certification Format: accounts/{account}/languages/{language_code}/productCertifications/{id} Where `id` is a some unique identifier and `language_code` is a 2-letter ISO 639-1 code of a Shopping supported language according to https://support.google.com/merchants/answer/160637.
**productType**: Optional. These are your own product categorization system in your product data.
**title**: Required. This is to clearly identify the product you are certifying.
